Modul htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer
Package htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer.controller

Klasse LeaderboardController

java.lang.Object
htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer.controller.Controller
htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer.controller.LeaderboardController
public class LeaderboardController extends Controller
Controller class for managing the global leaderboard UI in the Minesweeper game.

This class is responsible for displaying the leaderboard for different difficulty levels (beginner, advanced, and pro), retrieving data from the leaderboard service, and formatting the displayed entries.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • LeaderboardController

      public LeaderboardController(String style)
      Constructs a new LeaderboardController with the specified style.

      This constructor initializes the controller and sets the visual style for the leaderboard.

      Parameter:
      style - The visual style used for the leaderboard (e.g., "retro", "modern").

  • Methodendetails

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the leaderboard UI.

      This method initializes the necessary UI elements, configures the stage with the specified style, sets up the leaderboard window, and displays it to the user.

    • initializeUserElements

      private void initializeUserElements()
      Initializes the UI elements for the leaderboard.

      This method sets up the leaderboard columns box, which contains the columns for different difficulty levels.

    • initializeWindow

      private void initializeWindow()
      Initializes the main leaderboard window.

      This method configures the layout, styling, and size of the leaderboard window. It also fetches the leaderboard data from the server and populates the columns with player entries for different difficulty levels. If the data cannot be loaded, an error message is displayed instead.

    • initializeColumnsBox

      private void initializeColumnsBox()
      Initializes the box containing the leaderboard columns.

      This method creates an HBox to hold the leaderboard columns for different difficulty levels (Beginner, Advanced, Pro). Each column is initialized with a header label and added to the box.

    • initializeColumns

      private javafx.scene.layout.VBox initializeColumns(String label)
      Initializes a leaderboard column with a header label.

      This method creates a VBox representing a column in the leaderboard, sets its layout properties, and applies styling. The column is initialized with a header label indicating the difficulty level.

      Parameter:
      label - The header label for the column (e.g., "Beginner", "Advanced", "Pro").
      Gibt zurück:
      A VBox representing the initialized leaderboard column.

    • formatLeaderboardEntry

      private String formatLeaderboardEntry(String username, int time)
      Formats a leaderboard entry with the player's username and their best time.

      This method creates a formatted string that displays the player's username (left-aligned with a fixed width) and their best time in seconds.

      Parameter:
      username - The username of the player.
      time - The player's best time in seconds.
      Gibt zurück:
      A formatted string representing the leaderboard entry. Example: "player123 : 45 seconds".

    • getMaxVBoxWidth

      public static int getMaxVBoxWidth()
      Gets the maximum width for the leaderboard VBox.
      Gibt zurück:
      The maximum width in pixels.

    • getMaxVBoxHeight

      public static int getMaxVBoxHeight()
      Gets the maximum height for the leaderboard VBox.
      Gibt zurück:
      The maximum height in pixels.

    • getRoot

      public javafx.scene.layout.VBox getRoot()
      Gets the root VBox of the leaderboard UI.
      Gibt zurück:
      The root VBox containing all UI elements for the leaderboard.

    • getStage

      public javafx.stage.Stage getStage()
      Gets the Stage used for the leaderboard window.
      Gibt zurück:
      The Stage object representing the leaderboard window.

    • getStyle

      public String getStyle()
      Gets the visual style of the leaderboard.
      Gibt zurück:
      A String representing the style (e.g., "retro", "modern").

      public void setStyle(String style)
      Sets the visual style of the leaderboard.
      Parameter:
      style - A String representing the style (e.g., "retro", "modern").
